goal.util

Class IterableFilter<T,U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.util.IterableFilter<T,U>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The input type.
    U - The output type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<U>

    public abstract class IterableFilter<T,U>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<U>
    Filters an iteration of Ts, and converts them into Us if it is decided that they should be in the iteration. The conversion is done by the select(T) method.

    Using yield return as an indicator what the next() method of the iterator() should return, the following pseudo-code describes the working of this class:

      for (T value : iterable) {
        U outValue = select(value);
        if (outValue != null)
          yield return outValue;
      }
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink

    • Method Detail

      • select

        public abstract U select(T value)
        Checks if the given value should be part of the iterated collection. If so, the value should be converted and returned. If not, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        value - The value that may or may not have to be in the iterated collection.
        Returns:
        null iff the given value should not be in the iterated collection. The converted value otherwise.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<U> iterator()
        Specified by:
